p: Experimental diabetes was induced by intraperitoneal injection of streptozotocin at the dose of 150 mg/kg on 16 h fasted mice [ 30, 31]. After thirty-minute STZ injection, mice were allowed free to food and water. After six hours, mice were allowed ad libitum glucose solution (5%) for one day to prevent hypoglycemic shock and death. After three days of streptozotocin administration, mice with fasting BGL >200 mg/dl were candidate for the experiment [ 27, 31– 33].
